column1: Lambert-Eaton syndrome is a disorder in which faulty communication between nerves and muscles leads to muscle weakness.
Lambert-Eaton syndrome is an autoimmune disorder.
In this syndrome, antibodies produced by the immune system attack nerve cells.
Lambert-Eaton syndrome may occur with cancers such as small cell lung cancer or autoimmune disorders such as vitiligo, which leads to a loss of skin pigment.

The main goals of treatment are to: - Identify and treat any underlying disorders, such as lung cancer - Give treatment to help with the weakness A treatment called plasma exchange or plasmapheresis usually improves symptoms.
Medications that suppress the immune response, such as prednisone, may improve symptoms in some cases.
